str2: A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To overlook, take no notice of, disregard. From huper and eido; to overlook, i.e. Not punish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Ignorance, inadvertence, sometimes with the idea of willful blindness. From agnoeo; ignorance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Everywhere, in all places. Genitive case of a presumed derivative of pas; universally.
From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.
